Summary Accomplished, results oriented Sr. H/W Engineer and Sr. H/W Test Engineer with high quality hands-on expertise with R&D LAB development. PC, Workstations, Web TV, Set Top Box, Video/Audio, Optical drivers, RF devices. Major strengths in high-speed Digital and Analog board design verification, hardware bring up, debug and prototyping development. Known for solving complex problems through precise root cause analysis. Eager to apply knowledge to practical uses and collaborate in a team environment.  
Specific skills include: 
* Expert knowledge of test equipment such as Logic Analyzers (16500), Digitized, FuturePlus-HT FS2240 Oscilloscopes with TDS, MSO family, Spectrum Analyzers, Audio precision, Network Analyzer, VM700 Video test equipment, and familiar with optical Test Equipment (83434A 10 GB/s light wave Receiver, 8156A Optical Attenuator 
* Expert in timing analysis, Jitter and signal integrity checking, including component verification. Prototyping development 
* Experience in DDR2_SDRAM, HT, AGP Timing and Signal integrity. 
* Expert with CAD/CAE tools such as ViewLogic, Altium, OrCAD, PSpice, and Labview 
* Experience Pentium/486/68020 experience; Video, Audio MPEG; considerable Analog, Digital, and consumer products. 
* Experience of PCI, PCI Express, USB, DDR2, SATA 
* Knowledge of FPGA with MAX+PLUS 2 AHDL of Altera, and Mentor Graphic.  
* Experience of multiplayer PCB layout and controlled impedance boards, electrical and mechanical. Generate Gerber files for fabrication. Generate Assembly drawings and BOMs. 
* Expert workmanship skill, including SMT and very fine pitch components. Summary ✉ Ameet.J.Kapadia@gmail.com 
 
I'm Hardware Validation Engineer with 12 years experience making sure customers get the highest quality and reliability in hardware.  
My focus is on rapid script development, debugging design or customer issues and automating everything for portability and repeatability.  
Also adept at training, presenting and leading groups. 
 
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬ 
 
Career Highlights: 
► Developed EDVT automation scripts for ASR9000 and 7600. New hires, interns and engineers not familiar with SW are all able to easily run tests and get data. The scripts are also robust enough to allow for advanced test sequencing and specialized testing.  
► Debugged and root caused weak memory component seen by large high profile customer. Fast setup, testing and results led to keeping customer confidence in company. 
► Developed testing methodology to exercise full range of memory. Catches defective components in customer returned boards as well as on future shipments. 
► Developed memory “eye” scanning scripts so dev team can determine usability of parts and what timing parameters to use for minimum chance of errors. 
► Trained new team in India for Bringup and EDVT on 7600. No impact to the next release and they continue to successfully provide support and development. 
► Mentor, train and support Interns and new hires. All interns are confidently in charge of their own project. 
► Developed and promoted prototype tracking database so that engineers can rapidly and easily enter data and key stakeholders can retrieve the most up to date data. 
► Designed and implemented test-bed for validating traffic with dynamic configuration scripts for rapid and thorough HW validation. 
 
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬ 
 
Specialties 
◆ Learning new concepts 
◆ Automating tasks 
◆ Scripting 
◆ Debugging 
◆ Teaching and Training 
 
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬

► Debugged and root caused weak memory component seen by large high profile customer. Fast setup, testing and results led to keeping customer confidence in company. 
► Developed testing methodology to exercise full range of memory. Catches defective components in customer returned boards as well as on future shipments. 
► Developed memory “eye” scanning scripts so dev team can determine usability of parts and what timing parameters to use for minimum chance of errors. 
► Trained new team in India for Bringup and EDVT on 7600. No impact to the next release and they continue to successfully provide support and development. 
► Mentor, train and support Interns and new hires. All interns are confidently in charge of their own project. 
► Developed and promoted prototype tracking database so that engineers can rapidly and easily enter data and key stakeholders can retrieve the most up to date data. 
► Designed and implemented test-bed for validating traffic with dynamic configuration scripts for rapid and thorough HW validation.

Summary Goals: I'm fascinated by waves, be they RF, Microwave, Optical, or acoustic. --and the development of hardware for making detailed observations and manipulations of those waves. From sensor to display, and from bits to waves and back, I'm enthusiastically seeking active engagement in the development of new tools.  
 
My professional background is widely varied, including these more recent experiences: 
-- Software defined radio implementation in FPGA fabric, using higher order languages (Synopsis SynplifyDSP, Xilinx System Generator, Matlab/Simulink) 
-- Extensive development of automated test hardware and software in a hi-rel development lab environment, using LabView and Matlab 
-- Communication Systems and Hardware development, including link budget analyses, hardware modeling, and laboratory test 
 
I'm especially interested in the development of hardware for unique installation environments, e.g., in space, at sea, or at extreme polar latitudes. 
 
Areas that I would like to further explore include the development of radar, sonar, or GPS hardware, and or the analysis and processing of the signals involved in such hardware. Specialties:-- Matlab/Simulink Expert with 20 years experience in hardware development, simulation, and physical modeling 
-- RF/Microwave Design 
-- Comm/DSP algorithm implementation in FPGA hardware using HOL tools such as SynplifyDSP and Xilinx System Generator, including Hardware-in-the-Loop development
